page.title: 06FARMING:TYPICAL ANNUAL CYCLE
page.content: (cont. from P.5){ {Potatoes} The ground is ploughed in late Autumn or early Winter.The best,"second year lay"soil on the farm is used for potatoes.This ground is harrowed in February and then it is covered with one ton per acre of potash manure. Then it is sprayed for wire worm and grubs in March.Before the potatoes are planted,the ground is chiselled and rotavated.The potatoes are planted with an automatic planter.Just before they break the ground,they are sprayed with 'Gramoxone'to kill weeds.Whilst they are growing,they are sprayed against blight every 8to10 days.When they,are fully grown the tops are burned off with 'Gramoxone' and the potatoes are left to ripen for a fortnight.After that they are harvested and stored.
